subject: 845p 5/30 Update: Spacewalk ends
body:
845p 5/30 Update: Spacewalk ends



=================================

CBS NEWS Coverage of Breaking Space News
Posted: 8:44 PM, 5/30/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Consultant

Changes and additions:

   05/30/07 (03:10 PM): Spacewalk begins
   05/30/07 (05:58 PM): Debris panels moved; antenna work on tap
   05/30/07 (08:30 PM): Spacewalk ends

=================================

8:30 PM, 5/30/07, Update: Spacewalk ends

Expedition 15 commander Fyodor Yurchikhin and Oleg Kotov closed the outer hatch of the Pirs airlock module at 8:30 p.m. today to officially end a successful five-hour and 25-minute spacewalk. The cosmonauts installed five protective micrometeoroid debris panels on the Zvezda command module and re-positioned a GPS antenna cable on the back of the module that will be needed to route navigation data to unmanned European cargo vehicles starting late this year.

This was the 82nd spacewalk devoted to station assembly and maintenance, pushing the total amount of ISS EVA time to 503 hours and 28 minutes since construction began in 1998. Yurchikhin and Kotov plan to stage another spacewalk next Wednesday to install 12 more debris panels on the command module.
